info.title: GigaLogistics API
info.description:
# Getting Started

Learn how to [authenticate yourself to GIGALOGISTICS](https://platform.gigacloudlogistics.com/docs/guide/guides/oauth2.html), and then use our sandbox environment to kick the tires and get familiar with our API. If you run into any problems, then be sure to check the error handling guide for tips.

Here are some step-by-step **tutorials** to get you started:

- [Learn how to create your first shipping label](https://platform.gigacloudlogistics.com/docs/guide/shipping-labels/create-label.html)
- [Learn how to list carriers](https://platform.gigacloudlogistics.com/docs/guide/guides/list-carriers.html)
- [Learn how to list carrier services](https://platform.gigacloudlogistics.com/docs/guide/guides/list-carrier-service.html)

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description:
To authenticate yourself to GIGALOGISTICS, you need to include an `Authorization` header in each API call. If you don't include a key when making an API request, or if you use an incorrect or expired key, then GIGALOGISTICS will respond with a `401 Unauthorized` error.

Learn more about API keys in our [authentication guide](https://platform-staging.gigacloudlogistics.com/docs/guide/guides/oauth2.html).

tags.name: Addresses
tags.description: No matter your shipping volume, failed deliveries and address change surcharges cut into your bottom line and damage perception with customers. Our address validation services ensure your packages make it to the right place the first time. Learn how to leverage our address validation services here.

tags.name: Shipments
tags.description: Shipments are at the center of the GIGALOGISTICS API. A shipment is the first step in creating a shipping label, or creating a manifest. It's also essential for getting shipping rates.

tags.name: Tracking
tags.description: Track packages with any one of our supported carrier accounts and create tracking events to keep your customers up to date. Easily integrate real-time tracking information for shipments into your application.

This request logistics company parameter verification is abnormal.

An access token is missing,expired,revoked,malformed,or invalid for other reasons.

| 401 Unauthorized |
**ACCESS_FAILURE**

Access to the resource is denied.

| 403 Forbidden |
**RATELIMIT_EXCEEDED**

The request was not accepted because the application has exceeded the rate limit.

| 429 Too Many Requests |
**DUPLICATE_REQUEST**

The transactionId is duplicated in the request.

| 429 Too Many Requests |
**THIRD_PARTY_REQUEST_ERROR**

An exception occurred while requesting a third party.

| 500 Internal Server Error |
**FULL_FAILED_ERROR**

Batch request completely failed exception.

| 500 Internal Server Error |
**SYS_ERROR**

Request could not be executed due to an internal server error.

| 500 Internal Server Error

tags.name: Version Change History
tags.description:
This is the list of changelogs of GIGALOGISTICS new release. You can get the detail information of each version's new features and bug solutions.

### Version: 1.0.20240507 (current)

### Changes
- Add Interface  [Create Shipment Async](#tag/LTL-Shipping/operation/createShipmentAsync)
  - See the interface description for details
- Add Interface  [Retrieve Async Shipments Result](#tag/LTL-Shipping/operation/LTLAsyncRetrieveShipmentsResult)
  - See the interface description for details
- Add Interface  [Pickup Request](#tag/LTL-Shipping/operation/pickup)
  - See the interface description for details
---

### Version: 1.0.20240315_Beta

#### Changes
- Update Interface [Validate Address](#tag/Addresses/operation/AdvcStreetLevel)
  - The interface structure has been adjusted from individual to batch, with the addition of the `clientReferenceId` field for matching responses in batch requests. 
  - A new rate limiting policy has been implemented for this interface, allowing a maximum of **2400** transactions per minute for each carrierID.
---

### Version: 1.0.20240122

#### Changes
- Update Interface [Manual push by Tracking Number](#tag/Tracking/operation/pushTracking)
  - Add webhook callback signature verification functionality. [Click to view details](https://platform.gigacloudlogistics.com/docs/guide/track/create-webhook.html).
- Add the address of the **Development Sandbox Server** environment, used for internal debugging and collaboration among developers. Please note that the tokens and carrierIds for each environment are distinct. Contact us to obtain them.
---

### Version: 1.0.20240111

#### Changes

- [Track Document](#tag/Tracking/operation/getTrackDocument) interface parameter adjustment
  - Adjust the interface parameter request from batch to individual parameter requests.
- Add the address for the US Production Server environment. Please be aware that when connecting to US nodes, a different token is required. Please reach out to us for obtaining the correct one.
---

### Version: 1.0.2023122801

#### Changes

- [Create Shipments](#tag/Shipments/operation/createShipment) interface parameter adjustment
  - Update field `shipper`, `returnAddress`
  > shipper.contact.companyName, returnAddress.contact.companyName, added maxmum 35 character limit.
- Add Interface [Restart Tracking](#tag/Tracking/operation/restartTrackNum)
    - See the interface description for details
- Add Interface [History Track by Tracking Number](#tag/Tracking/operation/getHistoryTrackInfo)
    - See the interface description for details
- Add Interface [Manual push by Tracking Number](#tag/Tracking/operation/pushTracking)
    - See the interface description for details
- 

---

### Version: 1.0.2023091402

#### Changes

- Add the address of the development sandbox server environment, used for internal debugging and collaboration among developers. Please note that the tokens and carrierIds for each environment are distinct. Contact us to obtain them.
- 

---

### Version: 1.0.2023083101_Beta

#### Changes

- Add Interface [Start Tracking a Package](#tag/Tracking/operation/registerTrackNum)
    - See the interface description for details

---

### Version: 1.0.2023082401

#### Changes

- [Create Shipments](#tag/Shipments/operation/createShipment) interface parameter adjustment
    - Update field `shipper`, `recipient`
    > shipper.address.city, shipper.contact.companyName, shipper.contact.personName, recipient.address.city, 
    recipient.contact.companyName, recipient.contact.personName added minimum 3 character limit.

---

### Version: 1.0.2023072701

#### Changes

- [Create Shipments](#tag/Shipments/operation/createShipment) interface adjustment
    - Update field `phoneNumber`
    > Adjust `recipient.contact.phoneNumber` for GEL to be conditional required
    - config timeout
    > config connect timeout with 60s

---

### Version: 1.0.2023070601

#### Changes

- [Create Shipments](#tag/Shipments/operation/createShipment) interface parameter adjustment
    - Update field `emailAddress`
    > Adjust `recipient.contact.emailAddress` for DPD_UK to be non-required

---

### Version: 1.0.2023062901

#### Changes

- [Create Shipments](#tag/Shipments/operation/createShipment) interface parameter adjustment
    - Update field `shipper`
    > This field is optional when the logistics company is **WHISTL**.
    > Add a description of the restrictions on this field for each logistics company.
    - Update field `recipient`
    > Add a description of the restrictions on this field for each logistics company.
    - Update field `itemTransactionId`
    > Applicable to `itemLines` object Add description information of this field.
    - Update field `dimensions`
    > Applicable to `itemLines` objects Required when the logistics company is **FedEx**.
    - Update field `payor`
    > Applicable to the payor information of the `paymentOption` fields, Adjust the description.
    - Update field `phoneNumber`
    > Applicable to the contact information of the `paymentOption` fields, When the logistics company removes the required verification for **FedEx**.
    - Update field `labelSpecification`
    > Add external link documentation for each logistics company label.

---

### Version: 1.0.2023060701

#### Changes

- [Create Shipments](#tag/Shipments/operation/createShipment) interface parameter adjustment
    - Update field `stateProvince`
    > Applicable to the address information of the `paymentOption` fields, When the logistics company removes the required verification for **FedEx**.
    - Update field `accountNumber`
    > Applicable to the payor information of the `paymentOption` fields, When the logistics company is **UPS**, this field must be 6 digits.

---

### Version: 1.0.2023052501

#### Changes

- [Create Shipments](#tag/Shipments/operation/createShipment) interface parameter adjustment
    - Add new field `instructions`
    > Applicable to the address information of the `shipper.address`fields, only applicable to GLS. 
    - Add new field `instructions`
    > Applicable to the address information of the `recipient.address` fields, only applicable to DPD_DE, DPD_UK, GLS. 

---

### Version: 1.0.2023051901

#### Changes

- [Create Shipments](#tag/Shipments/operation/createShipment) interface parameter adjustment
    - Update field `streetLine2`
    > Adjust `shipper.streetLine2` and `recipient.streetLine2` for DPD_DE to be non-required

---

### Version: 1.0.2023051601

#### Changes

- Adjust version number information.
- Modify the address of the `sandbox environment` and add the address of the `pre-release environment`.

---

### Version: 1.0.2023051101

#### Changes

- Add Interface [Create Shipments asynchronously](#tag/Shipments/operation/CreateShipmentsAsync)
    - See the interface description for details
- Add Interface [Retrieve Async Shipments Result](#tag/Shipments/operation/AsyncRetrieveShipmentsResult)
    - See the interface description for details

- [Create Shipments](#tag/Shipments/operation/createShipment) Interface parameter verification description adjustment
    - Update field `phoneNumber`
    > Modify the description of this field. When the operator is `FedEx`, add a special case description. For details, please refer to the interface document. The main scope of change `shipper`, `recipient`, `payor` objects.
    - Update field `customerReference`
    > Modify the restrictions of each logistics company for ref1~ref5 in this field.

---

### Version: 1.0.2023040301

#### Changes

- Add Interface [Track Document](#tag/Tracking/operation/getTrackDocument)
    - See the interface description for details

---

### Version: 1.0.2023032101

#### Changes

- [Create Shipments](#tag/Shipments/operation/createShipment) Interface parameter verification description adjustment
    - Update field `paymentOption`
    > Modify the verification information when using non-`SENDER` payment when the carrier is `FedEx` or `UPS`.
    - Added the description information of the specific verification rules of each logistics company, supplemented additional auxiliary information about fields such as `serviceType`, `weight`, `dimensions`, `declaredInfo`, etc.

---

### Version: 1.0.2023031401

#### Changes

- [Create Shipments](#tag/Shipments/operation/createShipment) interface parameter adjustment
    - Add new field `streetLine3`
    > Applicable to the address information of the `shipper`, `recipient`, `paymentOption`, and `returnAddress` fields, only applicable to FedEx, UPS. 
    - Update field `stateProvince`
    > Applicable to the address information of the `shipper`, `recipient`, `paymentOption`, and `returnAddress` fields, Required when the carrier is FedEx, UPS, optional in other cases.

- [Create Warehouse](#tag/Warehouses/operation/createWarehouse) interface parameter adjustment
    - update field `stateProvince`
    > Applicable to `originAddressre`, `returnAddress` field address information, only required when the country of the address is US.

post.description: Use this endpoint to request the OAuth token (bearer token) to authorize your application to access GigaCloud resources. You can pass this bearer token in your subsequent individual GigaCloud API endpoint requests.

schema.description: This is used to indicate the media type of the resource. The media type is a string sent along with the file indicating format of the file.

post.description: The address is automatically completed according to the keyword query. currently only supports the United States.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: This is the two-letter country code. [Find more info here](https://platform-staging.gigacloudlogistics.com/docs/guide/api-reference/country-code.html)

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: This is the keyword used to query address information.

post.description: Use this endpoint to validate postal codes and service commitments. Supports city, postal, country and Origin-Destination related lookups and validations. Currently only Fedex supports this feature.

Use this endpoint to get address resolution details. These details are the outcome of validatation and resolution of the input address. An address is stated as resolved when the input address matches the known reference data. Currently only Fedex supports this feature.

 > **Note:** This interface imposes a throttling limit of 2400 requests per minute for a single carrierId.

get.description: List all carriers that have been added to this account.
Get a list of the options available for the carrier
List the package types associated with the carrier
List the services associated with the carrier ID

post.description:
Make sure you ship as cost-effectively as possible by quickly comparing rates using the GIGALOGISTICS Rates API.  As long as you have the carrier connected to your account, you'll be able to see and compare different rates and services.
 > Currently this interface is only applicable to Fedex.
This API endpoint allows you to obtain a spot price quote for a shipment. Spot quotes are typically discounted rates based on excess carrier capacity vs contractual rates.

Indicate the address to be validated and resolved. This includes the address details, such as streetline, state or province code, country code and postal code.

 > Note: Up to 50 of these can be submitted in a single request.

clientReferenceId.description: Client Reference Id. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.

stateOrProvinceCode.description: This is the state or province code. Format and presence of this field will vary, depending on country.

city.description: Indicate the name of city, town, etc.

zipcode.description: Identification code of a region (usally small) for easier and accurate mail/package delivery. The format and presence of this field may vary depending on the country.

street1.description:
The first line of the street address. For some addresses, this may be the only line. Other addresses may require 2 or 3 lines.
 - At least one line is required for a valid physical address; empty lines should not be included.
 - Maximum up to three lines & no error check if entered more than this limit.
 - Recommended limit per line is 35 characters.

street2.description: The second line of the street address. For some addresses, this line may not be needed.

street3.description: The third line of the street address. For some addresses, this line may not be needed.

changed.description: Indicates if it has changed from the input address.

clientReferenceId.description: Client Reference Id. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.

streetLinesToken.description: Indicates the resolved street address lines.

stateOrProvinceCode.description: This is the state or province code. Format and presence of this element will vary, depending on country.

countryCode.description: This is resolved ISO alpha 2 country code.

customerMessage.description:
This is specifies Alert details returned in the reply such as code, message and any other parameters.
 Following are informational code and messages with respect to the results:
 - INVALID.SUITE.NUMBER - Invalid or missing Apartment/Suite
 - SUITE.NUMBER.REQUIRED - Invalid or missing Apartment/Suite
 - PARTIAL.STREET.MATCH - A street address is required for delivery. The entered address is a street number range.
 - MISSING.OR.AMBIGUOUS.DIRECTIONAL - Invalid or missing address directional.
 - INTERPOLATED.STREET.ADDRESS - Unable to confirm exact street number for the entered street name. The address falls within a valid range for the street name.
 - RRHC.CONVERSION - A street address is required for delivery. The address has been converted from a rural route.

cityToken.description: This is the resolved city name with a token. The token is an indication to the changes made.

postalCodeToken.description: This is the resolved postal code with a token. The token is an indication to the changes made.

parsedPostalCode.description: The postal code specified in a form that is supported by USPS as base, secondary and tertiary.\n - Base - AddOn - DeliveryPoint

addOn.description: Indicates the secondary value in Postal Code.

deliveryPoint.description: Indicates the tertiary value in Postal Code.

classification.description:
This is the classification type of a FedEx address.Valid values:
 - BUSINESS
 - RESIDENTIAL
 - MIXED (If it is a multi-tenant based address and contains both business and residential units.)
 - UNKNOWN (If just a zip code is provided, Address Validation Service returns `unknown` for the business/residential classification.)

postOfficeBox.description: Indicates if the resolved address is a P.O. Box.

normalizedStatusNameDPV.description: Indicates the presence of a delivery point such as a mailbox. Provided only for US addresses that are standardized against Postal Data.

standardizedStatusNameMatchSource.description: Indicates the source from which the standardized address is matched.

resolutionMethodName.description:
Indicates the resolution method used to resolve the address.Valid values: - USPS_VALIDATE
 - CA_VALIDATE
 - GENERIC_VALIDATE
 - NAVTEQ_GEO_VALIDATE
 - TELEATLAS_GEO_VALIDATE

ruralRouteHighwayContract.description: Indicates if the resolved address is a Rural Route or Highway Contract (US only). It returns true if it is rural route.

generalDelivery.description: Indicates the mail service is for those without permanent address. The mails for this address are held at a post office. Only applies to addresses that can be standardized against Postal Data. Not provided for US Geo Validated addresses. Note: Only returned when the address cannot be resolved.

attributes.description: These are the key-value pair as additional information returned along with the address processed by the system. These attribute will list what is working and what is not on the input address. For More information, look in to Chapter Address Attributes in the Overview.

resolvedAddress.description: Indicates the list of resolved addresses. The detailed resolved address includes city, state, postal information, and resolution method.

alerts.description: Indicates API Alerts includes alert type, alert code, and alert message that is received when the address is resolved.

Indicate the type of rates to be returned.Following are values:

 - ACCOUNT - Returns account specific rates.

requestAction.description:
This is the pickup action to perform. If the request is for Estes to pick up a full trailer, choose HE (to indicate empty) or HL (to indicate loaded). If you need Estes to drop off an empty trailer, choose SE. If the request is for a pickup of freight from your dock that is not a trailer-load, then pass LL (or dont pass this element, and it will default to LL). If Estes must call to set up an appointment before arriving, then pass AP. Valid values are listed below:

 `AP`:Appointment required 

 `HE`:LTL hook empty 

 `HL`:LTL hook loaded 

 `LL`:LTL live load 

 `SE`:LTL spot/drop empty

 > - For the paymentType `RECIPIENT` in UPS in the United States, both the zipCode and accountNumber are mandatory.

masterTrackingNumber.description:
This is the number associated with the package that is used to track it.For child shipment of an oneLabelAtATime  shipments,this should be same as the masterTrackingNumber of the parent shipment.

 > **Note:** When the associated masterTrackingNumber is specified, it is only valid when oneLabelAtATime is true.

oneLabelAtATime.description:
This flag is used to specify if the shipment is singleshot Multiple-Piece Shipping or one Label at a time,  piece by piece shipment. Default is false. If true, one label at a time is processed.

 > **Note:** When this is true, the number of `itemLines` can only be 1.

special_service.description: These are special services that are available at the package level for some or all service types.

specialServiceTypes.description: Indicate the types of special services requested for the shipment.

specialServiceAttributeList.description: These are special services dynamic fields

key.description: click here to see Package Special Service Types

value.description: click here to see Package Special Service Types

CustomerReference.description: Custom messages to print on the shipping label for the package. These are typically used to print invoice numbers, product numbers, or other internal reference numbers. Not all carriers support label messages. The number of lines and the maximum length of each line also varies by carrier.

ref1.description: Refer to field 1, there are differences between various logistics companies, see the external link for details.

ref2.description: Refer to field 2, there are differences between various logistics companies, see the external link for details.

ref3.description: Refer to field 3, there are differences between various logistics companies, see the external link for details.

ref4.description: Refer to field 4, there are differences between various logistics companies, see the external link for details.

ref5.description: Refer to field 5, there are differences between various logistics companies, see the external link for details.

itemTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your package. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.

 > **Note:** The itemTransactionId is consistent with the business unique identifier used in the interface for getGigaTrackNumberBatch API, which will affect the uniqueness of giga tracking numbers.

sequenceNumber.description:
Used only with individual packages as a unique identifier of each requested package. 

 > - Required for Multiple-Piece Shipping.
 > - The sequenceNumber for master package must be equal to 1 in case of Multiple-Piece Shipping.
 > - Duplication is not recommended in the case of Multiple-Piece Shipping.
 > - Currently this field is only applicable to FedEx.

packageCode.description: The package type, such as `THICK_ENVELOPE`, `SMALL_FLAT_RATE_BOX`, `LARGE_PACKAGE`, etc. The code `CUSTOM_PACKAGE` indicates a custom or unknown package type. current version is not used.

weight.description: These are the package weight details.

dimensions.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.

 - Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
 

 > **Note:** Required if current carrier is WHISTL, FedEx.

declaredInfo.description: This is the Declared Value of any shipment.This is including, but not limited to any loss, damage, delay, misdelivery, any failure to provide information, or misdelivery of information related to the Shipment.

currency.description: The currencies that are supported by GIGALOGISTICS.

amount.description: The monetary amount, in the specified currency.

customerReference.description: This is a customer reference type. The value specified here for the element is printed on the Commercial Invoice only for tracking and label information.

externalDocs.description: Click to view customer reference limit

taxableEntityType.title: taxable_entity_type
taxableEntityType.description:
The taxable entity type for this tax item. Valid values include the following.

 | Value     | Description 
 |---------|----------------
 |`SHIPPER`  |  The shipper is responsible for this tax.    
  |`RECIPIENT`  | The recipient of the shipment is responsible for this tax.

identifierType.title: identifier_type
identifierType.description:
The carrier service used to ship the package.

 |Identifier Type     | Service Name 
 |---------|----------------
 |`VAT`  |  The tax identifier is a Value Added Tax.
  |`EORI`  | The tax identifier is an Economic Operators Registration and Identification Number (EORI).
 |`SSN`  | The tax identifier is a Social Security Number.
 |`EIN` | The tax identifier is an Employer Identification Number (EIN).
 |`TIN` | The tax identifier is a Tax Identification Number (TIN).
 |`IOSS`    | The tax identifier is an Import One-Stop Shop (IOSS).  
 |`PAN`  | The tax identifier is a Permanent Account Number (PAN).
 |`VOEC`  | The tax identifier is a Norwegian VAT On E-Commerce(VOEC).

issuingAuthority.description: The authority that issued this tax. This must be a valid 2 character [country code](https://platform-staging.gigacloudlogistics.com/docs/guide/api-reference/country-code.html).

referToItemTransactionId.description: refer to which package by ItemTransactionId.

description.description: A description of the item. Maximum length is 200.

quantity.description: The quantity of this item in the shipment. Minimum length is 1, Maximum length is 99999.

amount.description: The monetary amount, in the specified currency. Minimum length is 0.01, Maximum length is 9999999.99.

currency.description: The currencies that are supported by ShipEngine are the ones that specified by ISO 4217: https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html

harmonizedTariffCode.description: The Harmonized Tariff Code of this item. Maximum length is 8.

countryOfOrigin.description: The two-letter ISO 3166-1 country code where this item originated.

fabricContent.description: Description of the product fabric being shipped. Maximum length is 200.

weight.description: The unit weight of the customs items. value Minimum length is 0.01, Maximum length is 9999999.99.

sku.description: The SKU (Stock Keeping Unit) of the customs item. Maximum length is 255.

skuDescription.description: Description of the Custom Item's SKU. Maximum length is 40.

contents.description: The type of contents in this shipment. This may impact import duties or customs treatment.

nonDelivery.description: Indicates what to do if a package is unable to be delivered.

customsItems.description:
Customs declarations for each item in the shipment. The difference between each carrier is as follows.

 > - **DPD_UK** : Required.

carrierId.description: The carrier account that is billed for the shipping charges.

serviceType.description: The carrier service used to ship the package, such as `FEDEX_GROUND`, etc.

shipper.description:
The shipment's origin address. If you frequently ship from the same  , consider creating a warehouse. Then you can simply specify the `warehouseId` rather than the complete address each time.

 > **Note:** Either `warehouseId` or `shipper` must be specified.However, for some carriers, there is no need to fill in shipper information which is maintained in the carriers management system. For example: EVRI, WHISTL.

paymentOption.description:
Specifies the payment details specifying the method and means of payment to carrier for providing shipping services. The difference between each carrier is as follows.

 > - **FedEx** : Required.
 > - **UPS** : Required.

warehouseId.description: The [warehouse](https://platform-staging.gigacloudlogistics.com/docs/guide/other/guide-to-reading.html) that the shipment is being shipped from.

returnAddress.description: The return address for this shipment. European logistics is not applicable, if there is a return, it will be returned to the shipping address.

multiplePieceShipping.description: In the case of Multiple-Piece Shipping, Indicates the tracking details of the package. Only applicable if the carrier is FedEx.

itemLines.description:
The packages in the shipment.

 > **Note:** Some carriers only allow one package per shipment. If you attempt to create a multi-package shipment for a carrier that doesn't allow it, an error will be returned.For example: DPD_UK, etc.

taxIdentifiers.description:
The difference between each carrier is as follows.

 > - **DPD_UK**: Required, Required combination: EORI(SHIPPER) + IOSS(SHIPPER).

customs.description:
Customs information. This is usually only needed for international shipments. The difference between each carrier is as follows.

 > - **DPD_UK** : Required.

imageType.description: Format of the label. For requests, please use get service to see available formats

fileUrl.description:
The URL of the shipping document/label.

 > **Note:** When fileUrl is null, fileBase64 must have a value, otherwise, when fileUrl is not empty, fileBase64 is null

fileBase64.description: Base64 string representing label data. Decode this from base64 to get your label in the right encoding. E.g. a png label decoded from base64 and saved as a .png file will work as a .png image

phoneExtension.description: Specify contact phone extension. Maximum length is 6.

The state or province.  For some countries (including the U.S.) only abbreviations are allowed.  Other countries allow the full name or abbreviation.

errorMsg.description: The reason for the data not being queried.

bizUniqId.description:
Business unique identifier, when the logistics is regular express delivery, affects the uniqueness of the GIGA waybill number. This field is mandatory when `gigaTrackingNumber` is empty.

 >**Note:** Consistent with the dispatch unique identifier `itemTransactionId` in the [Create Shipments](#tag/Shipments/operation/createShipment) interface, used to determine the uniqueness of the GIGA waybill number.  If the `bizUniqId` conveyed through the transaction registration interface matches the `itemTransactionId` during the purchase transaction,  then the same GIGA waybill number as returned by the purchase transaction interface will be retrieved from the transaction history interface.

carrierKey.description: The unique code of the transporter generated by DRPTool, This field is mandatory when `gigaTrackingNumber` is empty.

trackingNumber.description: Official website waybill number, This field is mandatory when `gigaTrackingNumber` is empty.

gigaTrackingNumber.description: GIGA waybill number is generated when purchasing through the logistics center. This field can replace the combination of `carrierKey`, `trackingNumber`,  and `bizUniqId`. When all are filled, gigaTrackingNumber takes precedence.

tag.description:
Custom label, with a maximum limit of 65535 bytes, can be filled with notes, descriptions, data identifiers, and other information.

 >**Note:** When using `tag` to generate an Excel statistical file, please ensure that the data format is correct. In this context, the **columnName** value corresponds to the Excel column heading. **sort** specifies Excel column sorting. **value** displays data in a table. Be careful to avoid duplicate **sort** values, as duplicates will result in only one column being generated.

shipFrom.description: Place of origin, generated in the order of city, state, and country. Subsequent logistics centers will update and correct based on the transaction history information.

shipTo.description: Destination, generated in the order of city, state, and country. Subsequent logistics centers will update and correct based on the transaction history information.

actualPickUpDate.description: Actual Pickup Time in Timestamp Format.

lastNodeStatusCode.description:
GIGA logistics status identification code, mapped by the logistics center. Valid values include the following.

 | Value     | Description 
 |---------  |----------------
 |`1`        |NOT FOUND   
 |`2`        |INFO RECEIVED
 |`3`        |PICKED UP 
 |`4`        |IN TRANSIT
 |`5`        |DELIVERED  
 |`6`        |EXCEPTION

lastNodeStatusDescription.description: GIGA logistics status description, mapped by the logistics center. The value is Description in the **lastNodeStatusCode** description table.

eventInfoVos.description: Logistics company scan event information for a shipment. Includes the list of events and/or scans applied.

city.description: The name of the city, town, etc.

stateCode.description: This is a placeholder for State or Province code.

countryCode.description: Placeholder for country code for the address.

location.description: Location Identification for facilities identified by an alpha numeric location code.

eventCode.description: Field which holds the code identifying the type of scan event.

eventTime.description: Date and time of the scan event. timestamp format.

eventTimeUTC.description: Date and time of the scan event. UTC format.

eventDescription.description: Field which holds the text description of the scan event.

logisticsStatusCode.description:
GIGA logistics status identification code, mapped by the logistics center. Valid values include the following.

 | Value     | Description 
 |---------  |----------------
 |`1`        |NOT FOUND   
 |`2`        |INFO RECEIVED
 |`3`        |PICKED UP 
 |`4`        |IN TRANSIT
 |`5`        |DELIVERED  
 |`6`        |EXCEPTION

logisticsStatusDescription.description: GIGA logistics status description, mapped by the logistics center. The value is Description in the **logisticsStatusCode** description table.

exceptionFlag.description: Mark whether this node is an exception node. `S` identifies normal nodes, and `E` identifies abnormal nodes.

daysAfterTransit.description: The number of days between the first event and the 'Successful Signing' event. Before there is no 'Successful Signing' status, this item is always 0 and does not accumulate. After successful receipt, the number of days between receipts will be displayed.

daysAfterLastUpdate.description: The number of days between the last event and the latest synchronization success time without update, the cumulative count. Please note that when the logistics status is `DELIVERED` and has been delivered, this data is meaningless.

lastSyncTime.description: The last time to synchronize the logistics company.

lastSyncSuccessfulTime.description: Finally successfully synchronized the time of the logistics company.

weight.description: Field which holds the weight of the package.

dimensions.description: Indicate the dimensions of the package.

volume.description: Indicate the volume of the package.

pieces.description: Field which holds the total number of pieces.

trackingStatus.description: Track status information. Y - Tracking, N - Stop tracking.
